verses.kjv: Then Job answered and said,
verses.ct: Then Job responded:

verses.kjv: I know it is so of a truth: but how should man be just with God?
verses.ct: "Yes, I know this is true. But how can any human being be righteous before God?

verses.kjv: If he will contend with him, he cannot answer him one of a thousand.
verses.ct: If someone tried to argue their case with him, they couldn't answer even 1 out of 1,000 of his questions.

verses.kjv: He is wise in heart, and mighty in strength: who hath hardened himself against him, and hath prospered?
verses.ct: His wisdom is profound and his power is immense — who has ever defied him and come out ahead?

verses.kjv: Which removeth the mountains, and they know not: which overturneth them in his anger.
verses.ct: He moves mountains before they even realize it; he topples them in his anger.

verses.kjv: Which shaketh the earth out of her place, and the pillars thereof tremble.
verses.ct: He shakes the earth from its foundations, and its pillars tremble.

verses.kjv: Which commandeth the sun, and it riseth not; and sealeth up the stars.
verses.ct: He gives an order to the sun, and it doesn't rise; he locks away the stars.

verses.kjv: Which alone spreadeth out the heavens, and treadeth upon the waves of the sea.
verses.ct: He alone stretches out the heavens and walks on the waves of the sea.

verses.kjv: Which maketh Arcturus, Orion, and Pleiades, and the chambers of the south.
verses.ct: He made the Bear, Orion, and the Pleiades, and the constellations of the southern sky.

verses.kjv: Which doeth great things past finding out; yea, and wonders without number.
verses.ct: He does great things beyond understanding, and countless wonders beyond number.

verses.kjv: Lo, he goeth by me, and I see him not: he passeth on also, but I perceive him not.
verses.ct: When he passes by me, I can't see him; when he moves past, I don't detect him.

verses.kjv: Behold, he taketh away, who can hinder him? who will say unto him, What doest thou?
verses.ct: If he snatches something away, who can stop him? Who would dare ask him, 'What are you doing?'

verses.kjv: If God will not withdraw his anger, the proud helpers do stoop under him.
verses.ct: God does not hold back his anger; even the allies of Rahab cower beneath him.

verses.kjv: How much less shall I answer him, and choose out my words to reason with him?
verses.ct: So how could I possibly argue my case with him, or find the right words to reason with him?

verses.kjv: Whom, though I were righteous, yet would I not answer, but I would make supplication to my judge.
verses.ct: Even if I were innocent, I wouldn't try to answer him — I could only beg my judge for mercy.

verses.kjv: If I had called, and he had answered me; yet would I not believe that he had hearkened unto my voice.
verses.ct: Even if I called out and he responded, I wouldn't believe he was actually listening to me.

verses.kjv: For he breaketh me with a tempest, and multiplieth my wounds without cause.
verses.ct: He crushes me with a storm and piles up my wounds for no reason.

verses.kjv: He will not suffer me to take my breath, but filleth me with bitterness.
verses.ct: He won't even let me catch my breath but fills me with bitterness instead.

verses.kjv: If I speak of strength, lo, he is strong: and if of judgment, who shall set me a time to plead?
verses.ct: If it's a matter of strength — he is the powerful one. If it's a matter of justice — who could summon him to court?

verses.kjv: If I justify myself, mine own mouth shall condemn me: if I say, I am perfect, it shall also prove me perverse.
verses.ct: Even if I declared myself innocent, my own mouth would condemn me. Even if I claimed to be blameless, it would only prove me guilty.

verses.kjv: Though I were perfect, yet would I not know my soul: I would despise my life.
verses.ct: Even if I were blameless, I wouldn't care about my own life; I would despise my existence.

verses.kjv: This is one thing, therefore I said it, He destroyeth the perfect and the wicked.
verses.ct: It all amounts to the same thing — that's why I say: he destroys both the blameless and the wicked.

verses.kjv: If the scourge slay suddenly, he will laugh at the trial of the innocent.
verses.ct: When disaster brings sudden death, he mocks the despair of the innocent.

verses.kjv: The earth is given into the hand of the wicked: he covereth the faces of the judges thereof; if not, where, and who is he?
verses.ct: The earth is handed over to the wicked; he blindfolds its judges. If it's not him doing this, then who is it?

verses.kjv: Now my days are swifter than a post: they flee away, they see no good.
verses.ct: My days race by faster than a runner — they fly past without experiencing anything good.

verses.kjv: They are passed away as the swift ships: as the eagle that hasteth to the prey.
verses.ct: They slip away like swift boats, like an eagle swooping down on its prey.

verses.kjv: If I say, I will forget my complaint, I will leave off my heaviness, and comfort myself:
verses.ct: If I tell myself, 'I'll put aside my complaints, I'll change my expression and try to be cheerful' —

verses.kjv: I am afraid of all my sorrows, I know that thou wilt not hold me innocent.
verses.ct: I'm still terrified by all my suffering, because I know you won't declare me innocent.

verses.kjv: If I be wicked, why then labour I in vain?
verses.ct: Since I'm already considered guilty, why should I struggle for nothing?

verses.kjv: If I wash myself with snow water, and make my hands never so clean;
verses.ct: Even if I washed myself with the purest water and scrubbed my hands completely clean,

verses.kjv: Yet shalt thou plunge me in the ditch, and mine own clothes shall abhor me.
verses.ct: you would still throw me into a filthy pit until even my own clothes would be disgusted by me.

verses.kjv: For he is not a man, as I am, that I should answer him, and we should come together in judgment.
verses.ct: God is not a human being like me, so I can't challenge him, and we can't face each other in court as equals.

verses.kjv: Neither is there any daysman betwixt us, that might lay his hand upon us both.
verses.ct: There is no mediator between us — no one who could place their hand on both of us.

verses.kjv: Let him take his rod away from me, and let not his fear terrify me:
verses.ct: If only he would remove his punishment from me, and stop letting his terror overwhelm me —

verses.kjv: Then would I speak, and not fear him; but it is not so with me.
verses.ct: then I could speak without being afraid of him. But that's not how things are for me."
